column4: Is there anything to do about the poor rendering of .png pictures in a .pdf file using Evince?
not sure ... but it doesnt seem to be poor rendering on this end
are they your images or ones that cam with the pdf
they are my images, and they look fine in okular.
ah  mm  what resolution did you save them as  and how did you create the pdf?
ah ok, perhaps I should update.
generall I use inkscape to create pdf files and set DPI either at 300 dpi  or 600dpi
this way regardless of printed size both images and text should be near flawless
I don't know the DPI, I get the images from the program, root.. Is there a way to check it?
well, it looks fine when I print it.
oh ok  let me check on testing dpi hold on
interesting that evince is doing this... although I find okluar nice but a bit much for my needs
yeah, it very strange and kinda irritating. Okular is too bloated somehow, and I like evince.
